page.title: 19Evaluation of Gordon
page.content: There are four shops. The customers think they are handy for the older people and quite cheap. The shops appear to be the right size for the villagers. The most used shop is the Post Office which sells everything. Most customers find it convenient to go to larger shops in town to get a bigger selection. The most common complaint of the housing in Gordon is the lack of insulation. People can hear their neighbours conversations. The heating is found to be inefficient in the winter and expensive. Gardens are found to be too small and not private enough.There are not enough leisure facilities in Gordon to suit both old and young. Many people work outside the village.If factories were built in Gordon they would spoil the community atmosphere. Most adults like the village as it is.
